intro: Stigmaphyllon heterophyllum, commonly known as the Brazilian starleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
